title: Voice SDK
description: Voice SDK enables you to bring voice interactions to your app experiences.
longDescription:
Please see what voice enabled experiences that developers have been building with Voice SDK for inspiration. [Video]

We are so pleased to invite you to watch Unreal Voice SDK on Meta Connect 2022. [Video]


Please try our sample project to learn how we add Voice Interactions into a game.


-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Use Voice SDK to enhance your users’ AR/VR experience with more natural and flexible ways for people to interact with your app. For example, interactive conversation can make an app more engaging, or voice commands can shortcut controller actions with a single phrase.


Powered by the Wit.ai Natural Language Understanding (NLU) service, Voice SDK is compatible with Meta Quest headsets, mobile devices, and other third-party platforms. Wit.ai is Meta’s natural language processing platform that can help you build voice Experiences in your game. Wit.ai is easy to sign up for, and it’s free. Using Wit.ai, you can easily train apps to use voice commands with no prior AI/ML knowledge required. The combination of Voice SDK and Wit.ai empowers you to focus on the creative and functional aspects of the app, while enabling powerful voice interactions.


Common Use Cases

Using Voice SDK, you can turn your users’ game into a powerful voice experience that can create an even greater sense of immersion.

Here are a few examples of what you can enable with voice experiences:

  • Voice-driven gameplay and experiences. Users immersing themselves completely in your game can significantly increase their enjoyment. Imagine winning a battle by activating a magic spell with your voice or actually talking to the characters in your story. Voice-driven gameplay can make experiences more immersive, even close to magical.
  • Voice navigation and search. Navigating unfamiliar nested menus can be time-consuming and difficult, especially when your user is trying to type into a VR keyboard using a controller. Voice SDK can help your users get where they want to go quickly, and with far less effort.
  • Voice FAQ. Searching for instructions is a good way to frustrate your user and break their focus on your app. But what if new players could just ask when they need a hint? Not only could that be helpful, but it might also keep them engaged longer.


Links: Video | Docs | Github | Forum | Privacy
technicalDetails:
Features:

  •  Voice Command with free ASR (Automatic Speech Recognition), NLU (Natural Language Understanding).
  •  TTS (Text to speech)
  • Dictation (New)

Code Modules:

  • Voice SDK, core module providing developer facing nodes and apis for using voice commands, tts, and other voice related features. 
  • Wit, which is the core of this plugin providing wrappers around Wit.ai APIs.
  • Wit-editor, which is the editor code.

Number of Blueprints: 10 (in the content folder for demo purpose)

Number of C++ Classes: 69

Network Replicated: (No)

Supported Development Platforms: Win64

Supported Target Build Platforms: Win64, Android, Oculus

Documentation: here

Example Project:  sample project

Important/Additional Notes: Guide of creating apps on wit.ai can be found here
